summary: This document is an email chain from August 13, 2019, containing the final statement the Department of Justice (DOJ) planned to release regarding actions taken following the apparent suicide of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details the temporary reassignment of the MCC warden, the appointment of an acting warden, and the administrative leave of two staff members pending investigations.

events.title: DOJ Announces Actions Following Epstein's Death
events.description: The Attorney General directed the Bureau of Prisons to temporarily reassign the warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York and place two staff members from Epstein's unit on administrative leave, pending FBI and OIG investigations into Epstein's apparent suicide.

events.title: Apparent Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The document references the apparent suicide of Jeffrey Epstein, a former inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, which triggered FBI and OIG investigations.

keyFacts: The Attorney General directed personnel changes at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York following Jeffrey Epstein's apparent suicide.
The warden of MCC New York was temporarily reassigned to the Bureau of Prisons' Northeast Regional Office pending investigations.
The warden of FCI Otisville was named Acting Warden of MCC New York.
Two MCC staff members assigned to Jeffrey Epstein's unit were placed on administrative leave.
The actions were taken pending the outcome of FBI and Office of the Inspector General (OIG) investigations into Epstein's death.
